root.text:
Hi everyone,

I’ve completed the assignment tests for the project (easy, medium, and hard) for <https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/time-dependent-constraints-in-gfpop#solutions-of-tests|Time-dependent constraints in gfpop> .
I’d now like to ask: where should I share my proposal draft, and how should I go about reaching out to a potential mentor for this project?

Looking forward to your suggestions.

Best regards,
Priyansh Saxena

elements.text:
Hi everyone,

I’ve completed the assignment tests for the project (easy, medium, and hard) for

.
I’d now like to ask: where should I share my proposal draft, and how should I go about reaching out to a potential mentor for this project?

Looking forward to your suggestions.

Best regards,
Priyansh Saxena

text: You should contact the mentors directly via the contacts on the project page, in this case: <https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2025/wiki/time-dependent-constraints-in-gfpop#mentors>. It's unlikely they'll be able to give feedback before the deadline but there's no harm in sending a message to let them know you what plan to submit (you must submit the proposal directly to Google by 1800 UTC and I recommend not leaving it to the last minute as late applications are not accepted!)

. text:
Hi Heather,
Thank you so much for the guidance!

I had emailed the test solutions to the mentor listed on the project page about three days ago and have also sent my proposal to them. Just wanted to check if there's any other recommended way to reach out.

Appreciate all your support throughout the process!

Best regards,
Priyansh Saxena
